definition: to send (on errand)
difference/discrepancy/to differ/error/to err/to make a mistake
to differ from/to fall short of/lacking/wrong/inferior/Taiwan pr. [cha1]
to send/to commission/messenger/mission
to dispatch/to send/to dispel

sentences.english: I Jesus have sent mine angel to testify unto you these things in the churches.
sentences.chinese: 我耶穌差遣我的使者爲衆教會將這些事向你們證明。

sentences.english: And the king sent, and they gathered unto him all the elders of Judah and of Jerusalem.
sentences.chinese: 王差遣人招聚猶大和耶路撒冷的衆長老來。

sentences.english: The God who sent Brother Branham and this Message did not change.
sentences.chinese: 差遣伯蘭罕弟兄以及這信息的神並沒有改變。

sentences.english: And king Solomon sent and fetched Hiram out of Tyre.
sentences.chinese: 所羅門王差遣人往推羅去，將戶蘭召了來。

sentences.english: And David sent messengers to comfort him concerning his father. So the servants of David came into the land of the children of Ammon to Hanun, to comfort him.
sentences.chinese: 於是大衛差遣使者爲他喪父安慰他。

sentences.english: Fill your horn with oil and be on your way; I am sending you to Jesse of Bethlehem.
sentences.chinese: 你將膏油盛滿了角，我差遣你往伯利恆人耶西那裏去。

sentences.english: This is the one about whom it is written: "`I will send my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare your way before you.
sentences.chinese: 經上記着說，我要差遣我的使者在你面前，豫備道路。

sentences.english: God sent Jesus so you could know what He's like.
sentences.chinese: 神差遣主耶穌來到世間，使你能看見他的樣子。

sentences.english: So the king sent a third captain with his fifty men.
sentences.chinese: 王第三次差遣一個五十夫長，帶領五十人去。

sentences.english: Then the king sent and gathered together all the elders of Judah and Jerusalem.
sentences.chinese: 王差遣人招聚猶大和耶路撒冷的衆長老來。

sentences.english: At that time did king Ahaz send unto the kings of Assyria to help him.
sentences.chinese: 那時，亞哈斯王差遣人去見亞述諸王，求他們幫助。

sentences.english: Then Balak sent other princes, more numerous and more distinguished than the first.
sentences.chinese: 巴勒又差遣使臣，比先前的又多又尊貴。

sentences.english: He ridicules her and orders her around like she is his maid or something.
sentences.chinese: 他不僅會嘲笑她，還會當她是女僕似的差遣來差遣去。

sentences.english: He ridicules her and orders her around like she is his maid or something.
sentences.chinese: 他不僅會嘲笑她，還會當她是女僕似的差遣來差遣去。

sentences.english: And he sent again a captain of the third fifty with his fifty.
sentences.chinese: 王第三次差遣一個五十夫長，帶領五十人去。

definition: to wait for (orders, a decision, a judgment)
to dispatch/to assign/a dispatch
to obey an order/to take orders/to accept a state of affairs
servant
to tell/to instruct/to command
to wait upon/to serve/to attend to sb's needs
servant
to attend to/to care for (patients etc)/to look after/to wait upon/to serve/also written 伏侍, see also 服事[fu2 shi4]
ten thousand deaths will not prevent me (idiom); ready to risk life and limb to help out
official post/billet/commission/CL:件[jian4]/see also 差事[chai1 shi5]
to send/to assign/to appoint/servants of an official/official messenger
to serve/to wait upon
decree/order
to serve (in some capacity)/to work for
to follow everywhere/to always be there for sb at their beck and call
to control
to urge (sb to do do sth)/to drive (sb to take an action)
